unnormalised: ## Oh No, She Didn't! Why Your Shopping Cart is Feeling Like a Rejection in a Karan Johar Movie
normalised: Oh No, She Did Not! Why Your Shopping Cart is Feeling Like a Rejection in a Karan Johar Movie

unnormalised: Picture this: You’re browsing through Myntra, feeling like Deepika Padukone in *Cocktail*, ready to revamp your entire wardrobe. You’ve found the perfect lehenga for your cousin Priya's wedding (Rs. 5000, cha-ching!), that cool Bandhani saree your mom would totally approve of (Rs. 2500, double cha-ching!), and a pair of ridiculously impractical, but oh-so-stylish, jhumkas (Rs. 800, because YOLO!). You add everything to your cart, feeling like a shopping queen ready to conquer Diwali.
normalised: Picture this: You are browsing through Myntra, feeling like Deepika Padukone in Cocktail, ready to revamp your entire wardrobe. You have found the perfect lehenga for your cousin Priya's wedding (rupees five thousand, cha-ching!), that cool Bandhani saree your mom would totally approve of (rupees two thousand five hundred, double cha-ching!), and a pair of ridiculously impractical, but oh-so-stylish, jhumkas (rupees eight hundred, because Y O L O!). You add everything to your cart, feeling like a shopping queen ready to conquer Diwali.

unnormalised: But then...BAM! Reality hits harder than a Delhi summer. You see the total – Rs. 8300 – and suddenly you’re back to earth. You remember your EMI payments, that overdue bill at the local Kirana store, and the fact that you promised your mom you wouldn't spend so much this month. You close the tab, promising yourself you’ll come back later... but "later" never comes.
normalised: But then...BAM! Reality hits harder than a Delhi summer. You see the total – rupees eight thousand three hundred – and suddenly you are back to earth. You remember your E M I payments, that overdue bill at the local Kirana store, and the fact that you promised your mom you would not spend so much this month. You close the tab, promising yourself you will come back later... but "later" never comes.

unnormalised: Sound familiar? You've just committed the dreaded act of cart abandonment! You've left your shopping cart feeling emptier than IIT Delhi on a Sunday morning.
normalised: Sound familiar? You have just committed the dreaded act of cart abandonment! You have left your shopping cart feeling emptier than I I T Delhi on a Sunday morning.

unnormalised: But don't worry, you're not alone! Millions of customers abandon their carts every day. It’s a universal struggle, a modern-day *Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham* of retail. Maybe the shipping costs were higher than expected (Rs. 200! Seriously?!), or perhaps the website demanded too much information (Do they REALLY need my auntie’s maiden name?).
normalised: But don't worry, you are not alone! Millions of customers abandon their carts every day. It is a universal struggle, a modern-day Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham of retail. Maybe the shipping costs were higher than expected (rupees two hundred! Seriously?!), or perhaps the website demanded too much information (Do they REALLY need my auntie’s maiden name?).

unnormalised: Whatever the reason, the result is the same: a frustrated retailer and a cart full of lonely, unloved items.
normalised: Whatever the reason, the result is the same: a frustrated retailer and a cart full of lonely, unloved items.

Because nobody wants a sad, empty shopping cart, right?
